name: Vizing's conjecture
rephrased: For any two graphs G and H, the domination number of their Cartesian product is at least the product of their individual domination numbers.
implication_form: If G and H are graphs, then the domination number of G ◻ H is at least γ(G) times γ(H).
explained: Vizing's conjecture states that for any two graphs G and H, the domination number of their Cartesian product G □ H is at least the product of the domination numbers of G and H. Formally, if γ(G) denotes the domination number of graph G, then γ(G □ H) ≥ γ(G) * γ(H).
related_conjectures: Fajtlowicz's conjecture (about the domination number of the Cartesian product of two complete graphs)
